articles.title: About this blog
articles.description: Welcome to my rebuilt blog for DACSS Social Networks, Text-as-Data, and Machine-Learning - Noah Milstein Masters Student in DACSS and The University of Massachusetts Amherst
articles.contents:
Noah Milstein (857) 259-0812 | linkedin.com/in/noah-milstein-/ |
nmilstein2017@gmail.com |
https://github.com/nmilsteinuma
Adaptable Masters’ graduate student graduating in May, seeking a
position that allows me to apply my research skills to create useable
data, analyze with computational techniques, interpret outcomes, and
visualize.
SKILLS
Skills: Python (NumPy, Pandasand analysis along with visualization), R
(Tidyverse, Web Scraping, Text Analysis, Regression, Network Analysis,
Machine Learning, Visualization with ggplot2, and Dashboarding), Excel
(Data Analysis, Pivot Tables), Github.
EDUCATION
University of Massachusetts Amherst Amherst, MA School of Social and
Behavioral Sciences Expected May 2023 Master of Science in Data
Analytics and Computational Social Science. • Overall GPA 3.89 Relevant
Coursework: Machine Learning, Political Network Analysis, Text as Data,
Quantitative Analysis, Probability Theory
University of Massachusetts Amherst Bachelor of Arts Major in Economics,
Magna Cum Laude, with department honors from Phi Beta Kappa Graduated
May 2021
• Overall GPA: 3.93, Phi Sigma Pi Scholarship Chair, WMUA Member
ACTIVITES AND PROJECTS UMass Landscape Architecture and Regional
Planning Amherst, MA Winter 2022 – Present
Climate Migration Project • Generated data using census and commercial
housing data in R and FEMA data in QGIS to analyze underlying migration
patterns and probable change while collaborating with qualitative
researchers to expand data applicability. • Collaborated with an
interdisciplinary group of researchers to analyze and predict migration
in the Northeast due to climate change.
UMass DACSS Amherst, MA Summer – Fall 2022
Department Financial Dashboard Project
• Cleaned, analyzed, and visualized cash flows from university data
while integrating projection algorithms with historical student data.
• Created and developed a financial dashboard for the department using
flexdashboard and shiny. • Acted as the group leader delegating tasks to
the other two team members and communicating progress.
Scholarship Chair Phi Sigma Pi Beta Upsilon Executive Council Member and
Scholarship Chair Fall 2019 – Spring 2021 • Coordinated and planned
events related to scholarship including study groups, a professional
development and resume workshops. • Adapted my role during covid to fit
the diverse academic and regional backgrounds of the group.
WORK EXPERIENCE UMass Landscape Architecture and Regional Planning
Amherst, MA Job-Board Web Scraping Project Winter 2022 – Present
• Coded algorithms in R software using rvest to scrape job board
information stored in HTML which was then tabulated and analyzed using
text-analysis packages including quanteda, plyr and tidytext. •
Communicated and integrated stakeholder input to adjust the algorithms
and correct data to better serve their needs.
Burlington Wine and spirits Burlington, MA Sales Associate August 2020
– Present • INCREASED SALES OF FINE WINES BY UTILIZING KNOWLEDGE OF
REGIONS, FLAVOR, AND PRICE WITH THE STATED TASTES OF THE CUSTOMERS.
Harvard University, Samuel Laboratory Cambridge, MA
Research Intern July 2015 – August 2017 • Conducted research on C.
Elegans and Drosophila behavior using 3-D imagining and predictive
software in MATLAB.
